short_description: This biodiversity data collection method involves recording as many species as possibe within a specific area and time frame, such as one day. Teaching materials are searchable and widespread.
A method of categorising waste, particuarly plastic, collected from beaches and/or rivers.
A EU-funded plastic monitoring campaign, with particular focus on lesson material for school children.
A project investigating how well water can drain away (for example, in your garden) by measuring soil moisture, porosity and infiltration capacity.
A community beach monitoring project where phone stands are placed at various coastal viewpoints so participants can take and upload photos of the changing coastline.
The "Community Collaborative Rain, Hail and Snow Network", a voluntary precipitation measurement project in the USA.
A water level tracking app for use in rivers and canals. Observe water influx after rainfall and potential low water levels in dry periods.

Earth Challenge is an NGO that tries to help answer global questions at yearly campaigns using citizen science methods. There are resources available to participate by organising a satellite event from wherever you are.

project_name: Effects of Covid-19 Litter on animals
short_description: An investigation of litter associated with Covid, such as facemasks.

Participate in water quality checks by taking a picture of river or sea water colour with the app, which is then manually and automatically compared to reference colours that give an indication of water quality.
A North American bird survey that encourages volunteers to observe and record birds at feeders during the winter months to support bird population research.
Report horseshoe crabs you see on beaches in Florida, to keep watch for spawning activity and aid conservation efforts.
Stream quality project "Our Rivers" in Germany.
A protein-folding computer game where high scores are researched as protein structure possbilities.
A NASA-backed citizen science project where users track cloud cover changes and types to help validate satellite observations and to support climate reseach.
A global bird counting event once per year, over the course of 4 days.

project_name: Hui O Ka Wai Ola (Association Of The Living Waters)
short_description: Measure physical and chemical parameters of Hawaii coastal waters.
A platform that tracks seasonal migration patterns of various species (like monarch butterflies) across North America. Includes teaching tools.
A litter collection app with a tagging system to categorise the litter. Originally established to help influence environmental policy.
Parameters: Temperature, soil moisture, humidity, flora
Take a photo of dog poo to track water contamination in areas with many pet dogs.
Phosphate strips to test in rivers and other water bodies, with an app
A UNESCO initiative to monitor climate change effects on coasts (mainly on small islands)
Riverbank monitoring for trash
Investigating the decomposoition rate of tea leaves within plastic teabags.
A global microplastic monitoring initiative.
An app to record the location and health of threatened trees.
Aquatic animals data collection
An open platform to collect any stories around the Nieuwe Maas.
A water quality testing kit, plus organised river walks in Europe you can (partially) join to help raise awareness of waterway health.
Water testing kit
Organise various projects
An open-source noise pollution testing kit
Nitrate strip kit for water testing, and data map
Platform for professional surface flow measurements, with an app
Water testing kit
Free mobile data-gathering platform
For recording groundwater data
Paid survey builder and app
Identifying Flora and Fauna with applications on smartphone
Real-time air quality sensor network
Identifying Flora and Fauna with applications on smartphone
Paid data collection software
Flora and Fauna AI image recognition with an app, with post-validation
app
Connect a sensor to your phone
Air and noise measurement kits and sensor network.
Identifying Flora and Fauna with applications on your smartphone
Connect your weather station to a global map
Offers water quality measurment tools and services, e.g. Caddisfly
Biodiversity data collection app
Biodiversity data mass collection event (with Minka)

Design a survey, quiz, or poll using an online tool such as Google Forms, to collect feedback or vote on something within the project. For example, volunteers can submit how they would like to be involved in the project using a survey.
Design a scavenger hunt tailored to adults or children that encourages participants to look for items or organisms of interest. For example, an endangered species bingo card.
Organise a Hackathon to program a tool, analyse the dataset, or any other aspect of the project that would benefit from collective programming effort.

Organise a Working Bee: a community event were volunteers are assigned duties to collaboratively complete a large and/or multi-faceted task. For example, you might organise a Working Bee to clean a protected nature area, where one team is on rubbish collection, one team is on sign construction, and another team is on barrier fence construction.
